docs.snippet: With the after-touchdown kick almost automatic — successful almost 100 percent of the time — N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell suggested that it may be time to eliminate it altogether....
docs.lead_paragraph: With the after-touchdown kick almost automatic — successful almost 100 percent of the time — N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell suggested that it may be time to eliminate it altogether.
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; Commissioner Roger Goodell suggests alternative point format for touchdowns, saying that extra-point kick has become automatic and uninteresting; other football news noted.

headline.main: Goodell Says Extra Point Is Pointless

docs.snippet: Fans at home run the risk of being desensitized to football’s endless stream of injuries, but safety issues seem to have made players more compassionate toward one another....
docs.lead_paragraph: Fans at home run the risk of being desensitized to football’s endless stream of injuries, but safety issues seem to have made players more compassionate toward one another.
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports Of The Times column analyzes American appetite for violence that is an integral part of the NFL's success; holds that while football fans may well have become desensitized to injuries, safety issues seem to have made players more compassionate toward each other over the years.

headline.main: Numb to Violence? Fans, Maybe, but Not Players
headline.print_headline: Numb to Violence? Fans, Maybe, but Not Players

docs.snippet: Give anti-Semitism and other forms of hatred an inch and they will try to take a mile. So football authorities in England are right to stamp out a salute being used to bait Jews in neighboring France, before it takes root in the English game....
